sub_topic: Identifying the clique number of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph below:

![graph](https://i.imgur.com/LOwtKJH.png)

What is the clique number of this graph?
message_2: The clique number of a graph is the size of the largest complete subgraph (clique) in the graph. In the given graph, the largest complete subgraph consists of 4 vertices (A, B, C, and D) that are all connected to each other. Therefore, the clique number of this graph is 4.
